de.bioforscher.singa.mathematics.algorithms.superimposition

Interface Superimposition<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SubstructureSuperimposition, VectorSuperimposition

    public interface Superimposition<T>
    Representing a superimposition that is defined by a root-mean-squared deviation, a translation vector and a rotation matrix. A superimposition can be applied to arbitrary candidates

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String RMSD_FORMAT_PATTERN 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<T> applyTo(java.util.List<T> candidate)
      applies this superimposition to a list of candidate
      java.util.List<T> getCandidate()
      Returns the candidate that was used for this Superimposition.
      default java.lang.String getFormattedRmsd()
      Formats the given RMSD value.
      java.util.List<T> getMappedCandidate()
      Returns copied mapped candidates that were used to compute this superimposition, only containing the objects that were used to compute this superimposition.
      default java.util.List<T> getMappedFullCandidate()
      Returns the full copied mapped candidates, which contain all objects of type T, regardless of the ones used to calculate this superimposition.
      java.util.List<T> getReference()
      Returns the reference that was used for this Superimposition.
      double getRmsd()
      returns the root-mean-squared deviation of this superimposition
      Matrix getRotation()
      returns the rotation Matrix of this superimposition
      Vector getTranslation()
      returns the translation Vector of this superimposition

      • getCandidate

        java.util.List<T> getCandidate()
        Returns the candidate that was used for this Superimposition.
        Returns:

      • getMappedCandidate

        java.util.List<T> getMappedCandidate()
        Returns copied mapped candidates that were used to compute this superimposition, only containing the objects that were used to compute this superimposition.
        Returns:
        the candidates that were used for superimposition

      • getMappedFullCandidate

        default java.util.List<T> getMappedFullCandidate()
        Returns the full copied mapped candidates, which contain all objects of type T, regardless of the ones used to calculate this superimposition. The default method simply returns the mapped candidates as is.
        Returns:
        the candidates with their original objects that were used for superimposition

      • applyTo

        java.util.List<T> applyTo(java.util.List<T> candidate)
        applies this superimposition to a list of candidate
        Parameters:
        candidate - the candidate to which the superimposition should be applied
        Returns:
        a new copy of the superimposed candidates
